CatDescriptText: Norbet Garies, 239 Madison Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 28, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "What do you think is wrong with the Pittsburgh Pirates? Do you think that they are using their best ball players at all times?" answer reads: "I think so.  As I understand it, even when a policeman is off duty, he is allowed to make an arrest."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Norbet Garies wearing light colored button down collared shirt with breast pockets and rolled up sleeves and hat, standing in front of building corner, right store window displaying picture of Asian girl, brick building with signs inscribed "...liquor" and "bob...shoe store" in background
